intro: Delosperma imbricatum, commonly known as the ice plant, is a succulent shrub native to southern Africa. It features fleshy, blue-green leaves that are covered in a fine, powdery coating, which helps reduce water loss. The plant produces vibrant clusters of pink or purple flowers during the summer months. It is drought-tolerant and thrives in well-draining soil, making it suitable for rock gardens and xeriscaping. Its ability to store water in its leaves allows it to survive in arid environments.
